profileText: A Representative from Virginia; born in Portsmouth, North Hampton County, Va., April 3, 1843; merchant; lawyer, private practice; New York Volunteers, until 1865; clerk of the corporation court of Portsmouth, Va., 1865-1877; collector of internal revenue for the second district of Virginia, 1877-1885, 1889-1900; delegate to the Republican National Conventions, 1880, 1888, and 1896; elected as a Republican to the Forty-ninth Congress (March 4, 1885-March 3, 1887); was not a candidate for renomination in 1886; member of the Republican National Committee, 1888-1892; died on November 30, 1900, in Petersburg, Va.; interment in St. Joseph's Cemetery, Petersburg Va.

researchRecord.name: 1776-1948, 10 items.
researchRecord.description: The autograph book of James Dennis Brady contains letters to him from Ulysses S. Grant, Rutherford B. Hayes, Henry Cabot Lodge, William McKinley, and others concerning Republican Party politics. The collection also contains an autograph album (1881-1882) of prominent figures. There are also 2 facsimiles: (1817 Sept. 9) from Thomas Jefferson to Joseph C. Cabell; and George Mason's draft of the Virginia Declaration of Rights (1776).
